item.title: Then I saw her face, now I’m a non-believer!
item.author: Joshua Price,
item.description: Religion is one of those awkward words. To some, it represents all that is good in life, and the celebration of the divine. For others, it’s a term which is almost taboo, one of those awkward boxes that Facebook asks you to fill in. Yet, there’s no doubt that many religions have shaped past and …

item.title: SimCity (Not 5)
item.author: Joshua Price,
item.description: It’s been almost a year since I discovered the new SimCity was announced. Was it really, finally, possible that Maxis were making a new game, with that one feature that was missing from the previous versions? Could this really be the dawn of curved roads? Speculation aside, I was particularly …

item.title: Time, Dr. Freeman?
item.author: Joshua Price,
item.description: “Shouldn’t you have been in the test chamber half an hour ago?” asks the scientist standing next to me. Quite possibly – I’ve been running around this lobby for the past 20 minutes just trying to see if I recognise any of the equations on the whiteboards. Between the unresolvable scribbles, I think …
